general.byline: CS & Math student at UBC building distributed systems, cryptography tools, and helpful software
general.about:
I'm passionate about building systems that solve real problems. My approach is guided by "rejecting artificial bounds" - a philosophy I learned from mentors who showed me that exceptional versatility is possible when you focus on continuous learning and building.

From Arduino projects at 13 to distributed systems research at university, I enjoy tackling challenging, often obscure problems. I believe in contributing to communities and creating tools that help people work more effectively.

Currently doing research on real-time guarantees for edge computing.
